author: RoyalGreenTea

text:
Fantastic game, loved it very much and would rate it alongside my other favourite; Lost Odyssey. While it's obvious some things were changed from the original darker Mistwalker concept to suit Nintendo, the game was fantastic at keeping me engaged, and the combat keeps introducing new mechanics and elements right up until the very end. I prefer this thousand-fold over Xenoblade, which I found too padded with side-quests and such to keep me engaged.

Edit: Just to point out the biggest thing that drew me from Xenoblade was the lack of Audio Volume Options and coupled with that the non-stop shouting from the characters throughout combat, drowning out the fantastic OST.
author: Drazzan

text: I've heard mixed but generally positive reviews for this game. I actually don't know a lot about it which makes it even more exciting for me to play it someday and go in blind. As a big fan of Mistwalker, I'm very much looking forward to it. Looks like Uematsu brought the good stuff with his music! I really need to buy it before it becomes too rare.
author: SupraDarky

text: I've played about two hours of it so far, but distractions kept me from really being able to sit down and play it. I like what I saw. I love the characters so far, even if they are mostly stereotypical JRPG characters. Combat is very interesting, but difficult to describe. It's a game I wish I had more time for. It has that Final Fantasy feel to it, even more so than any of the recent FF games.
author: ZachTheZip

text:
@Nuahsy
No. I bought all of the operation:rainfall games and I wish we never got pandoras tower. So repetitive, lazy storytelling, average graphics even for the Wii, and the horrible glitch which crashes your system when trying to ented the optional towers without waiting half a year at the loading screen!

Never again. I resorted to using cheats to get through it just because I didn't wanna waste 30 bucks on a game I'd never complete.

Last story though was really enjoyable for me, and I just started xenoblade a week ago! (worth all 70 bucks worth so far)
